turns.content: Who are some notable classical guitar composers and what were their contributions to the genre?

3. Fernando Sor: Sor was a Spanish guitarist and composer who played a prominent role in the development of the classical guitar during the early 19th century. He wrote numerous works for the instrument, including operas and symphonies.

4. Heitor Villa-Lobos: A Brazilian composer, Villa-Lobos is known for his innovative use of Brazilian rhythms and folk melodies in his classical guitar works. He wrote a series of études (studies) that are still widely used as teaching material.

5. Mauro Giuliani: An Italian composer and guitarist, Giuliani was a prolific composer of works for the guitar, including sonatas, concertos, and études. He is also known for his collaborations with other musicians, such as the famous violinist Niccolò Paganini.
